Reviews.Title: “Great deal/location”
Reviews.Author: cmx3d2
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very close to the airport to which they offer a free shuttle. The staff very overly courteous in my opinion and was very helpful. Room we had was not outdated and was clean. The only "issue" we had was when checking out, something occurred in the computer system to which the receptionist had to call because we booked through Priceline and was at a lower rate. But this was resolved in a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Fills the bill as a hotel close to the airport”
Reviews.Author: MidwestBoomer
Reviews.Content: When you drive south on LeJeune Road from Miami International Airport, it's likely that this hotel will be the first one to catch your eye. That's the appeal: proximity. The shuttle from hotel door to airport check-in seemed to take only 5-10 minutes. The hotel itself is a multistory business-type hotel. My room was spacious and well-equipped but not stunning. I sleep easily, and I had no trouble with airplane noise despite proximity to the airport. It's across the street from the Latin Cafe. A Miami friend described this as a sort of local institution, popular with those who desire Cuban food. We met there for a delicious breakfast that made me a fan of cortaditos (espresso with milk and sugar). A tip: Latin Cafe has several locations--if you're meeting a friend, be sure they know which one to go to. Also, traffic is heavy on LeJeune Road--you'll need to walk a bit to a traffic signal in order to cross the street. It's close to a gas station to the south. This can be handy in filling the tank before you return your rental car--or making a purchase at its small convenience store. This hotel fills the bill--at least for me--as a place to stay in order to get an early morning flight out of the airport.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: twn030577
Reviews.Content: Reviewer mjg187 review was dead on! First I must say the staff and front desk are VERY polite, friendly, and helpful. Now for the disappointment....this hotel is older and has gone thru some renovations. It appears most of the money went to decorating the lobby which was very nice but not the actual rooms. The overall appearance of the room is not bad but just not Crown Plaza standards-appeared a little dated. Carpet & drapes are old and stained, bathroom needs a over-haul very old with cracked floor tiles. Toilet was rocky and stained. TV is extremely OLD and big. Horrible picture with static and limited channels. Lighting in the room is very dim. The meals in the Cafe are quite expensive. Breakfast should be included with room rates as this is a priority club property. Continental Breakfast was $14.95 if I recall and not worth it. A bowl of oatmeal and a cup of tea was almost $8 and dont forget the 15% surcharge (not gratuity). When asked why was there a 15% charge, waiter stated it was the hotels service fee not gratuity. This fee is usually charged for room service not dining in. As the other reviewer pointed out the key issue; safety assurance but quite annoying. You needed the key for everything however it deactivated almost after every use. They fitness room was a joke. It's a very small room with poor air circulation/ventilation. 2-3 treadmills, 1-eliptical and 1-seated bike/pedal machine. There are no weight machines or even hand weights. Overall this hotel is ok for short 2-3 day stays. This definitely not a 3.5-4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Next time I will look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: mjg187
Reviews.Content: Like others have said, this hotel is acceptable; however, it is below standard as far as the Crowne brand is concerned. I travel for a living and stay in many, many hotels; as a result, I bounce between being a Gold & Platinum Priority Club member. So where to begin: ***The rooms are small ***TV outdated (no HD) and few channel choices ***No fridge/ microwave ***No ability to open windows in room (no fresh air) ***Internet is painfully slow, so good luck if you're trying to actually accomplish work via the internet ***You need your room key to go anywhere in the hotel: elevator, laundry, gym, pool....you name it, don't go w/out your key or you're not getting in ***Speaking of the keys, they're electronic swipe cards (which is a good thing); but they lose the data with the change of the wind....so you're left heading back to the front desk to have them re-coded frequently Overall, this hotel is clean, and reasonably well maintained. It is suitable for a short stay (less than a week). My stay, unfortunately, was over a month and this is not an extended-stay type of hotel. Also, I typically don't have housekeeping in my room when I travel due to the problems that occur. Unfortunately, when your stay is longer than a few days, it's inevitable to need those services. Further validating my concerns about having people in your room while you're gone, I had an item stolen from my room during a housekeeping visit. It wasn't anything of significant value; but the principal of the matter should be of concern for guests. I realize this isn't a problem exclusive to this hotel (if you travel enough, you'll realize housekeeping is trouble anywhere you go). Overall, I give this hotel a mediocre rating and will look elsewhere next time I'm here on business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stopover”
Reviews.Content: Stayed here briefly on two separate occasions. Very convenient for MIA, with a frequent free and fast shuttle service. Front desk and bell staff were excellent - really welcoming, just what you want after a long journey followed by a very slow queue at Immigration! Room and bathroom were both clean and well equipped, although the decor is rather dated. Buffet breakfast was nice, though the dining room itself is rather unattractive, being dark and gloomy. The pool deck was useful for a bit of last minute sun and I appreciated the guest laundry for the holiday wash. All in all a good experience which we would be happy to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Suitable choice near the airport”
Reviews.Author: bemacol
Reviews.Content: I stayed there one night before the cruise and one night after the cruise. In both occasions I got a very good service from the staff. The rooms were clean and confortable. The downside, there is nothing around and it is located far from everywhere. Suitable choice if you are passing-by. Good shuttle service.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel with easy access to the airport.”
Reviews.Author: CalebL
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean and newish lenins and furniture. Old tube tv, no fridge or microwave. The gym is nice, on the second floor. Has 3 treadmills, an elliptical, stair climber and bike. All have attached tv but not all the TV's were working all the way. Food close to the hotel. Cuban place across the street, cheap breakfast ($6 including coffee) lunch in dinner cheap and a lot of it. Across the street to the left Miami subs. same side of the street to the left is Catch of the day seafood, to the right is Hereford steakhouse. The driver said the steakhouse is real good, about $30 price range. Not tried it yet. Past the steakhouse is a 6 screen movie theater, sign says $6 before 6 pm. Laundry: On site Laundry is only $1.25 wash and dry, on the second floor, 2 washers and 2 dryers. Dry cleaner: Out of the hotel right then right at light (7th street), down about a block or 2 on the right on the first floor of a little shopping center. Very limited English but got out of them that they don't do the per pound wash n fold. But shirt to wash n press is $2.25, $3.50 dry clean, pants $4 and $5.25. Backup laundry, past the dry cleaners down another block or 2 on the right in "International Plaza". First floor back right corner. Didn't see any signs about drop off service, would probably only use the place if the hotel laundry broke down. Drug store: Closest one is a walgreen's. Right out of the hotel down Lejune on the corner of 8th street, so about a mile, on the right. A couple of liquor stores and a small market right on 7th. I heard left on 7th down about a mile is a Winn Dixie grocery store and a casino.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable place to spend a night”
Reviews.Author: BTT65
Reviews.Content: We had to stay at this hotel due to a missed flight out of Miami. It was a clean and comfortable place with prompt shuttle service, a nice restaurant. Staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tarey
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel via Priceline - we wanted a hotel close to MIA as we had an early morning flight the next day. We showed up at 11am after a cruise and expected to wait to check in. But no, there actually was a room for us! The front desk personnel were terrific. 6th floor in the Quiet Zone. Everything was perfect in the room. Mid-afternoon I went to the front desk to repair a luggage tag; one of the staff got out the clear packing tae and proceeded to put it together for me. Great service. And the 6:20 shuttle (with a very friendly driver) left right on time. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Stay & cruise, to far out of Miami for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: HannahBWales
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from 15th-18th February 2012. I travelled with family. We had books 3 nights in Miami followed by a 7 night Caribbean cruise. We were given this hotel for the miami stay by the cruise company. There is a free shuttle from the airport to the hotel every 20mins which is very handy. The hotel is nice, clean with large rooms and the staff were friendly and helpful. There is a pool and fitness centre, however we did not use these. For people who want to visit Miami this hotel is a little far out, if we had been advised of this when booking we would have probably change hotels. We were told there is a shuttle to the centre but this was incorrect, I think this had been confused with the airport shuttle. It is $25 each way in a taxi to downtown Miami. We did this for 2 days, so the cost does add up. But for an airport hotel this is great. There are not many eateries around the hotel area, we ate out near the hotel once in a little local cafÃ¨ that was actually quite good and a lot cheaper than eating in the hotel. Would use again if just needed an airport hotel but otherwise would stay in Bayside or South Beach.

Reviews.Title: “highly over rated”
Reviews.Author: drudol
Reviews.Content: mostly american airlines personnel there between flights; food was marginal, not much in the area to walk to or even to exercise, but there is an exercise room that goes 24 hours. I know because I had to wait two hours for the room across from the exercise room and neither it nor my room was sound proof. the front desk said they were sold out and the rooms that were available were for the groups and not anyone who got a bargain rate through the email offers like I did.,..I guess you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Dont order room service”
Reviews.Author: flynryan
Reviews.Content: I ordered a pizza from room service that was advertised in a plastic display on top of the tv for $12. Later found out that after they added all their fees the $12 pizza became a $26 pizza. I expect room service charges but more than twice the price of order? Of course none of the fees were advertised on the flyer either and the total price was not quoted at the time of order.

Reviews.Title: “Overall a good stay”
Reviews.Author: dairocket
Reviews.Content: For a short stay its very good indeed,as staying in downtown you save quite a bit. The reception staff was very good and efficient. The restaurant staff was pretty slow, even when i was only there,you ordered breakfast,as you were eating the cerial they would bring out the cooked food,and that happened to everyone,not very good.The rooms were very clean,pool area very good. The Airport shuttle was also very good,i would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience”
Reviews.Author: Carol34162
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property in Jan. We were looking for a hotel with a Park, Stay and Go package so we could leave our car while we flew out of the Miami airport to the Carribean. We found the hotel to be clean, rooms spacious and little airport noise. The shuttle to the airport was very good ... had only a short wait when we returned from our trip. The parking also met our needs ... gaited with an attendant. Our only complaint was with the front desk. When we checked in they did not give us the vouchers for a free continential breakfast which was a part of our package. When we went down to eat the next moring before an early flight we were told we needed that. The front desk told us that it was not a part of our package and since i did not have the confirmation with me had to go back up to the room to get it. Another wait to be helped just took too much time so we had no breakfast that morning. They did give us credit for the breakfast which we used when we returned but they just were not nice about it ... no apology ... just O.K. we will add it to the return. I sure was glad i had the email confirmation and recommend that everyone be sure to bring it ... if it had just been a phone call we would not have gotten it. By the way it was a great breakfast. I would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly Reception Staff!”
Reviews.Author: foodfan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the beginning of January prior to flying home, the only real positive was the closeness to Miami Airport. Rooms could have been cleaner, especially bathrooms. Doors to rooms do not fit properly so masses of noise and light flooded in from corridor, together with paper thin walls meant that sleep evaded us! Not many restaurants nearby and the area was not really "comfortable" to explore. We will choose another of Miami airport's area to stay at next time.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Thiscarolina
Reviews.Content: I had stayed in this hotel a few times in the past and I used to enjoy the little lavender spray for sheets and the nice music system with relaxing music. This time, none of these was available, or if it was, it was not in my room. After about 20 min trying to check in (some problem with the reservation our assistant made that had me sharing the room with a colleague who had spend the previous night there) I was ready to go to the room. The front desk lady, nice enough, ensured me that nobody should be in the room as she had called...well, sure enough the room had someone (and not my collegaue as he was already in a different country) as I opened the door. After closing quickly I went back and asked to speak to a manager. He was less responsive than the front the desk lady about the incident, and seemed to care little that I had been trying to get to my room for more than 20 min and that I walked back and forth, up and down and up gain with a bad back and pulling my luggage in carpet. Luckily, the front desk lady sent someone to help me with the luggage to my new unoccupied room. I definetively will go to the Hilton next time and advise my colleagues to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more from a Crowne Plaza property”
Reviews.Author: Feistygal
Reviews.Content: I chose the Crowne Plaza because of its proximity to the airport and the free shuttle service. Both met my expectations. Room was clean, wifi was free, and furnishings were standard motel issue. What surprised me was that it felt like a motel, not a hotel--at least not my past experience with Crowne Plaza. The restaurant was especially disappointing. The menu was routine American fare, not even very much seafood for being within spitting distance of the ocean; one entree, one salad, one calamari and a bottle of wine for two people cost more than $100. The breakfast was even more expensive; the continental breakfast was $12 and the American breakfast was $14--but if you wanted oatmeal or fried eggs in addition to scrambled on the buffet you had to pay $2-4 extra per item. I've been to a lot of breakfast buffets with more options for less money. So if you don't intend to eat there, just sleep there between flights, this is a good choice. Otherwise....

Reviews.Title: “only if you get a rate near to $100”
Reviews.Author: numberoneson
Reviews.Content: this is just another tired out airport hotel, slightly better than others in this price range but I would never pay over $150 internet is still glacially slow and they try to sell you movies to watch on a 20 year old CRT screen the drivers and bellboys all congregate at the entrance blocking access in and out of the hotel, I actually had to say 'excuse me' the drivers and bellboys expect a tip even when the shuttle in no way was meeting their 30 minute schedule, I waited much longer

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: B.G._Chicago
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Miami Airport for two nights - both before and after our trip to Panama. The first night was a disaster - we were originally booked in a room on the second floor, which overlooked some machinery on the first floor that made a loud buzzing sound. When I went to lay down in the bed, I noticed there was a wrapper for peanut M&Ms under the chair by the window. Questionning the cleanliness of the room after that point, I then noticed a gross black hair in the bed. I called downstairs to obtain another room, and the front desk clerk was very unapologetic and it did not seem like she cared about the cleanliness issue. To the hotel's credit, they did move us to a room on the fifth floor, which was not as noisy. Given that we had already paid for our room upon our return from Panama, we stayed here another night upon our return. We stayed on the sixth floor that evening, and it was a better room. My suggestion would be to stay on one of the higher floors to aviod the buzzing noise. Based on the cleanliness issues we had in the first room along with the apathetic response from the front desk, we will not be staying in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: JmtEverett_Wa_
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night at the end of a cruise. We found the front desk staff to be efficent and cheerful. Our room was very nice and larger than most hotels we have stayed in. The room had a small refrigerator, large t.v. and coffee maker with real coffee mugs! The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is very close to the airport and planes are passing often. However we didn't notice the noise at all and I am a light sleeper. When we are in the area again the Crowne Plaza will be our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for a stop over - clean rooms, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Kate B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after an eight hour flight. The room was lovely and comfortable and we actually quite enjoyed the experience of being able to see planes flying over the pool! Everything was clean and the rooms were well equipped. The bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed a peaceful night's sleep. Room service was tasty and the service very quick and friendly. We had a slight glitch with breakfast, as the arrangements weren't made clear to us when we checked in - we woke up very early due to jet lag and there wasnt much available! One improvement I would suggest would be to offer free parking to guests. All in all, a nice hotel with good service.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: JohnycUK
Reviews.Content: We booked this last minute as it was close to the airport and we wanted a nights sleep before a long journey to Key West. we were very suprised as the reviews we read previous were not great and mentioned it being an old fashioned hotel. We found this to be completley not true. The hotel was clean and very upto date, the rooms were huge with great toiletries and little extras like room fragrance and wash bags. The beds were great and a huge tv. Parking was included therefore this was brilliant. Overall i would stay here again on a long trip, a shame this standard of hotels in South Beach is not the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool”
Reviews.Author: 34oceanspirit
Reviews.Content: This was our first night before a cruise, and was a good choice. A short wait for the shuttle, good check in, friendly staff, clean, and a classy hotel, but just starting to gracefully age. (eg. no big screen HDTV,but not so old that muzak was playing in the elevator...) Breakfast was not included, but was decent and at a reasonable price. Amazingly quiet rooms for being next to the flight path. A huge pool area with many chaises, palm trees, and even shady areas made the morning wait enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: meddiver
Reviews.Content: We did the park, sleep and fly. The room was very big and clean. The parking was secure and lighted. The price was good considering how close to the airport it is. Flight noise, not to bad.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Buxton Derbyshire in the High Peak Forest
Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buxtonworld
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very good for a stop over or a vacation. Great rooms and nice pool area even tho aircraft can be a bit noisy. The only problem I had was at check in . I found the 2 staff members on duty that I dealt with rude, not interested and told me to contact the main reservations centre as they did not want to deal with my reservation.I would go back to this hotel but the staff need retraining on CUSTOMER SERVICE.

Reviews.Title: “Functional hotel close to airport”
Reviews.Author: terry2ts
Reviews.Content: Just a one night stay this time between a flight from London and a cruise from Ft Lauderdale. The shuttle from MIA runs every 20 minutes but it can be difficult to spot the right shuttle in the dark as it has gone past you before you can read the sign on the side, Fortunately the aircrew were booked into the same hotel and they recognised the shuttle from the headlights and stopped it. Check-in was busy but efficient although the gentleman at the front desk refused to provide me with breakfast coupons despite my confirmation showing that breakfast was included in my deal. I returned to the front desk next morning with other guests who had had the same problem with the man and the coupons were issued without further delay. It was well worthwhile as the breakfast was excellent. The rooms were large as was the King-size bed and we slept well as we could barely hear the aircraft due to the insulation. The bathroom was again large and functional and the shower perfectly adequate. Whilst this may not be the best Crowne Plaza we have stayed at we will use it again for our next visit to Florida.

Reviews.Title: “It is near the airport and its nice.”
Reviews.Author: RADARSHE
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times for business trips. Bus runs every 20 minutes to the airport. Shuttle driver, front desk and cleaning staff all quite pleasant. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Swimming pool is on second floor is very nice. A few places to eat nearby. Hit the Catch of the Day restaurant less than a block away, especially for happy hour. The Latin Cafe is across the street. No going wrong here for staff, food or local ambiance. This hotel isn't near the tourist sites, but if you need a hotel near the airport or have transportation taken care of - stay here.

Reviews.Title: “The resturants are really great movie theater within walking distance.”
Reviews.Author: merajulhaq
Reviews.Content: After long flight hotel close to Airport is very good, they offers convenient services such as free, 24-hour airport shuttle service and free wireless internet access. this hotel has an outdoor pool and whirlpool tub you work out in the fitness centre or be productive in the business centre. They told me they have a free shuttle service to the nearby Dolphin Mall the bad part is the hotel is completely non-smoking hotel. For brekfast and lunch or dinner Cafe 950 is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “God stop over at Miami Airport”
Reviews.Author: Stewart1234567
Reviews.Content: Crowne Plaza, Le Juene Road, Miami Airport CanÂ´t really say more about this Hotel than has already been said. The staff are friendly and although there was a lot of aircraft noise outide the Hotel, none was apparent inside and I had a good nights sleep for my flight the next day. I dined in the bar and enjoyed it. Good value for money compared with others in the area. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mmm664
Reviews.Content: This was a good, clean hotel with fair customer service and nice, comfy beds and spacious rooms. I would stay there again and I thought it was very reasonably priced with a good restaurant. It is conveniently located. Overall, a good job is being done!! The only thing I would suggest is that some sort of poster should be placed at the airport informing customers of the times at which the shuttle bus goes by the airport to take customers to the hotel, as I wandered around for an hour looking for the bus and none of the airport staff knew where or when the bus left, so in the end I nearly got a taxi but just as I was getting one the bus pulled up!

Reviews.Title: “Less than impressed”
Reviews.Author: Chgochris1969
Reviews.Content: The room was very dated and 1995 27 inch Zenith TV was blurry since they had high def with no high def TV. Just pathetic. The service at the hotel was very unfriendly-- to park the car it was 13 a day-- because it was raining non stop we weren't able to use the pool and sun deck which did look nice.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel never ceases to amaze me!”
Reviews.Content: The hotel is the first that I have stayed in that has joined the clean world soap recovery program to provide soap for poor countries. Congratulations!

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed in Weeks”
Reviews.Author: Michellemck
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel - we had been on the go for 5 weeks in Europe and ended up here as we missed our connecting flight. American Airlines sent us here for the night and we were so happy. The bed was to die for after 5 weeks of European beds and pillows. the staff were friendly and very helpful. They best and cheapest way to call home and the hotel to advise where we were and when we would be arriving at our next destination. For plane buffs the flight path is directly over the hotel - the noise didn't bother us and wasn't that loud so sleeping wasn't a problem. Staff were very helpful when we asked where to go for dinner as we wanted to check out a little of Miami since we had to stay for a night - loved the hotel and would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: weigy01
Reviews.Content: Excellent value for money. Really comfortable room and excellent facilities. Complementry transport from airport and also a bus available to take you to a nearby mall and back for $10. Complimentary wifi was great too! The room included breakfast, although this was only a continental breakfast, if you wanted anything other than cereal, yogurts and breads, you would need to pay extra. The bar menu/light bites were limited; everything had fries etc so quite substantial. Would be good if you could purchase a sandwich from the shop or bar for when you need a light bite.

Reviews.Title: “Nice airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: rayd01
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times now and have never been disappointed. The hotel shuttle arrived promptly after I called the hotel and I was taken directly to the hotel. The service at check in was good and the hotel staff is very friendly. As a Priority Club Platinum member I was upgraded to a nice, large room. The room, as well as the rest of the hotel is very clean and there is a very nice gym. There are also several nice restaurants within walking distance. If you like a good steak, then I highly recommend La Patagonia Argentina, which I have also reviewed on Trip Advisor. It is a 10 minute walk from the hotel and well worth it. Overall this is a great hotel, especially for an airport hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here frequently for work”
Reviews.Author: OKtoGOnow
Reviews.Content: As an airline employee I have stayed here many times. The hotel staff is very nice and the overall quality of the property is very good. The rooms are quiet and clean and the beds are comfortable. The airport shuttle runs on time and the shuttle staff is courteous. Would definitely stay here if flying into or out of Miami. Not much around the hotel. Stay on the property and eat in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never again!”
Reviews.Author: Dive_Doctor
Reviews.Content: Drove down from Orlando and decided to overnight here since it was close to the airport. Big mistake! First of all, the barrier to the car park wasn't working with the hotel room card, so each time I was leaving, even though they promised someone would be there to open the barrier for me, I had to walk back to the lobby, and only then would someone come to open the gate. The walk from the car park to the rooms is EXTRA long. If you go shopping, be prepared to make a couple trips to the room to offload bags etc. When we were checking out, I asked if I could have the room card programmed to open the barrier and I would drop off in the drop box. Clerk insisted that it wouldn't be necessary because someone would be there to open the barrier. Guess what! Didn't happen! Had to walk back again, and then it seemed she remembered. One good thing was we got a late check-out, no hassle at all. It seems with so many hotels near the airport, they should all be competing with each other for providing customer service. Sad to say, there wasn't much here!

Reviews.Title: “Go somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: tashalynn29
Reviews.Content: it looks nice and the pool looks pretty especially at night. However, when I first stayed here, I had called about a microwave. They do not have them for the rooms, furthermore, the front desk staff I found to be rude. I even called the Intercontinental Customer Service, they promised to look into it but I never heard back. No fridges or micros in rooms, so if you travel for business, like me, you are out of luck here if you want to bring your own food. They want you to buy the expensive stuff in the restaurant I guess. Furthermore, the 3 times I have stayed here this summer, when you walk into your room, EVERY LIGHT WILL BE ON. All 4 lamps in my room were on, the bathroom light was on, and so was the light just inside the door. Also, the AC was blasting at 60. Even in Florida, I turned it off right away and still in the morning the room was a comfortable temp. What a collassal waste of electricity. Apparently, my room was not the only one with enough lights on to land a jet, my fellow flight crews notice this too. It has happened every time we stay there. Rude, wasteful staff. I deliberatly try to get rid of my Miami overnights just so I do not have to stay here. Period.

Reviews.Title: “Good location close to airport”
Reviews.Author: Neil F
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a few days either side of a trip to Brazil. The hotel is close to the airport and the shuttle bus takes only 5 to 10 minutes from the arrivals area at the airport. The actual hotel was clean and had a good atmosphere which not all airport hotels enjoy. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially when my plans changed and I needed an extra night. Of course being close to the airport means that the noise of aeroplanes can be an issue although the windows were triple glazed. This keeps out the noise but also the "fresh air". I always like to have a window open when sleeping so felt a little uneasy. The room was well equipped with everything required and the internet connection was fast which always helps when trying to work. The bed was very comfortable and as per normal with American hotels huge. If ever I am back in Miami for business I would certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from Room 215 BED BUGS Alert !!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jamaica_Beach_Bum
Reviews.Content: Missed my connecting flight due to a flight delay. American Airlines paid for my stay for one night on July 27th. The staff was friendly the Mojito at the bar was the best I ever had. The bed was very comfortable. The next morning I woke up to discover my legs had these angry looking bite marks all over them. The back of my left calf was swollen from all the bite marks. I am a nurse so I recognized the bite marks. Needless to say that is the reason I am giving the hotel a low rating.

Reviews.Title: “Good For One Night Stop”
Reviews.Author: hankski
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a short (free) shuttle ride from Miami International. Catch the shuttle on the top level (departures) inner loop (lane nearest to the terminal). It runs every 20-30 minutes and is well marked. The room that we stayed in was recently renovated. Note that this hotel is located right under the landing path for the airport (see attached photo from our 11th floor window). Our window was triple pane glass which helped keep the plane noise from being a bother. The restaurant was no-nonsense and functional... just what we needed after a long flight. The prices were good, the food was prepared with care, and the service was quick. The whole hotel appeared to be very clean and in top condition. We were pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and mojitos!!”
Reviews.Author: hurleyhermie
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Miami airport Crown Hotel and had great service. We were greeted with very friendly people at the desk.. the pool area was wonderful.. (fun to watch the planes go over.. and we didn't hear them while sleeping!) Wilson, the bartender makes the best mojitos!!! A great place to stay if you are flying out of the Miami airport for anything.. (FREE SHUTTLE)_!

Reviews.Title: “Average reasonable hotel - kids loved pool”
Reviews.Author: beachperls
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very average. It appears renovated not that many years ago. But the price performance ration is not favourable. I would only book this hotel again on comparable low rates. The Lobby was reasonable with nothing special about it. The reception service was conveniently helpful and welcoming. The room had a fashionable design, with todayâ€™s standards. Therefore the overall impression of the room was good. For example the bed and the TV looked very good. But the carpet looked reasonable average; no stains but also not new. Further, the bathroom was very clean and functioned well, but looked a bit aged. Overall we were pleased with our double bed room. The pool was reasonable big, appeared clean and our kids loved it. The pool was located on the second floor facing the sun and away from the busy street, hence it felt pretty good. But airplanes flies close over the building on their approach to Miami airport. This of course could disturbed some, but our kids thought it was cool. The Hotelâ€™s location is a plus; very conveniently close to bigger roads and inter states. However the parking costs approx 10 USD per day, which of course only is a small minus.

Reviews.Title: “Far away from a Crown Plaza employees lies straight thru.”
Reviews.Author: Mercokosher
Reviews.Content: I had a distressed rate, before check in I was assured that I would earn priority club points the holidayinn frequent program, it never posted. When I called, the reservation manager promised to review and answer within 24 hours, after 48 hours I called, and acknowledged that the employee made a mistake but still refused to credit the points, he said that Mr. Sahora will call me, never happened, but Mr. Sahora will post here to rebuke any complaint. At same time Sahora, should explain why carpets have a mildew odor. Why the airport shuttle takes over 20 minutes, why the driver's cant keep smoke free environment, and the gym is lousy as it can get. Reader be aware regardless what Sahora's replies, this place is far away from a real crown plaza, and never mind that the noise reduction(what is this Mr. Sahora?) is awesome, you hear every plane landing or taking off.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: vols1
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending AWS seminar and my daughter and I made the trip with him. The rooms were very clean. We were originally staying on 6th floor, but since my daughter and I would be using the pool quite a bit during the week we asked to be moved to 2nd floor. (where the pool is located.) Loved the sliding glass door that gave you direct access to patio. We went outside to catch the Dolphin Mall shuttle and waited about 15 min. The concierge came out to ask us if we were waiting for someone. He informed us that the shuttle sometimes gets there 5 minutes early and wouldn't be back for another 2 hours. He then contacted another shuttle that goes to other hotels and had them pick us up. This same concierge saw us going to eat breakfast the next morning and asked us if we made it the mall. He then offered us directions on how we could take the airport shuttle to the airport and them catch a bus that went straight to South Beach. This man went above and beyond to help us out. My daughter and I wouldn't have had the chance to get to the beach if he hadn't have told us about this as I was not comfortable driving there myself. Did not run into one rude employee there the whole time we were there. (8 days!)

Reviews.Title: “Make sure you get the right room key”
Reviews.Author: Sharon8822
Reviews.Content: Arrived late in the evening to find a queue for check in as there was trouble with the computer system. After approx 30mins got key to room and on entering found some other poor people in there in bed!!!! Back at reception met with little or no apologies for the stuff up. Given new room (unoccupied) with no offer of compensation for the inconvenience. In the morning tried to book a transfer to port with rude & unco-operative concierge who was more interested in his mobile phone that his hotel guests. After more mishaps, finally got a shuttle bus to port. Would not recommend this hotel to anybody although I notice that quite a lot of flight crew stay there. Poor them!!!!

Reviews.Title: “if you dont need anything- this is a transient hotel and you will be fine passing through”
Reviews.Author: frequentflier2001
Reviews.Content: If you do need anything or anything goes wrong, the night manager especially is arrogant, unrepsonsive and dismissive to needs of the customer. I was kept waiting 35 minutes while he pretended to solve a problem, put it on someone else, and then prevaricated, was rude and dismissive of my needs. While I can certainly understand hotel policy, etc. It is not the no, we cant that matters - it is the manner in which it is handled. This hotel is like a fast food chain on the freeway- fine if you are passing through, and you prob wont be back so who cares if your order is correct- Many of my collegues have similar stories to mine about the rudeness and arrogance and just plain disregard for anyone who has any needs outside of the canned here is your room style. There are good people there, and the calamari is devine. But, I will never spend another dime there and will dap to make sure my company removes our contract with them. One of the most ridiculous things is that they close the pool at 10p while the gym- also unsupervised is open 24 hours. There is no noise problem as it is under the airport path and the windows are sealed. Every other pool in Miami has a decent place tor relax and unwind at the end of a trip except for this Crowne Plaza. It is appalling that the customers are treated like cattle- Next- dont cause trouble, dont have anything that doesnt work in your room- dont have any special needs- dont come back if you do.... I would only recommend this place as a place to go to plan to sleep while waiting for your next flight AND if you cannot get in anywhere else. The night manager is particularly arrogant and dismissive and just downright rude and pretends to help while he totally ignores the problem = then gets even ruder when approached again after 35 minutes of patiently waiting. The neighborhood is not all that great- airport- noisy- strips- etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not this Crowne Plaza”
Reviews.Author: Rwq891
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Chain before but never again. This place needs an overhaul. The carpet, closet doors and mirrors need to be replaced. The repairs that were done were sloppy. The service was ok. FYI, you need to add the daily cost of parking to the quoted rate to get the true cost.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS BEDS, LARGE JACUZZI”
Reviews.Author: Choozie
Reviews.Content: Our party was 2 adults with 4 children over 11 years of age. We used this hotel as a stopover after a transatlantic flight and before a drive to the Orlando area. From Miami airport, we caught a free shuttle bus along with some flight crew to the Hotel, as most of the shuttle buses outside of the airport only go to the hire car pick up area, so watch out for that. The beds are the best feature of this hotel; they were so comfortable it was a total wrench to get out of them. The rooms were very clean and comfortable. We were able to order in a Dominos pizza into the hotel, and the reception staff were happy to give us the number as the restaurant in the Hotel was closed. Breakfast was plentiful and good, with hot food such as bacon and eggs as well as numerous cereals, breads, pastries etc. The indoor jacuzzi is large and boiling hot. There is a sauna also. The outdoor pool was fairly warm and very clean with lots of sunbathing beds. To get a shuttle bus to the car hire complex rather than the airport was a little bit tricky, but we asked a bus driver and he was happy to do a detour for a tip.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to previous Crowne Plazas”
Reviews.Author: mama4llama
Reviews.Content: We had a ground floor room, it fortunately allowed my smoker husband to step out for a smoke..we really appreciated that. BUT the planes sounded like they were going thru our room.People in the next room were also out on the patio until almost 2AM and we could hear them even with the sliding door shut and curtains drawn. I think they need to replace the sliding doors with a double pane ones to cut out the noise. Service was spotty, asked for a knife to cut a Mothers Day cake...was told to call room service, they said they'd call us back, 10 min later they said we'd have to come get it when they called us back again once it was "ready". By the time they called us, we had already eaten the cake. Towels we small, room felt old and not up to other Crowne Plazas we've stayed in. They are very close to the airport but a good 30-45 min drive from Sobe. The shuttle was very prompt for quick trips to the airport, thanks. Also you can walk to the corner or across the street for restaurants, or eat in the hotel. They have wifi, but it's very slow, still it's free and we appreciated that.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: karensolihull
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night before flying home from Miami and wished we could have stayed longer. Easy to find and front desk pleasant and quick to check us in. They also gave us a room upgrade as we were Priority Club Platinum and a free breakfast or free parking. Room was lovely and everything worked perfectly. We also really enjoyed the pool area, quiet and with comfy chairs and lots of fluffy towels. Didnt eat in the restaurant as no one was in there but chose the bar instead as it had a much nicer atmosphere. Food was really good and a decent price. Overall this was a great and enjoyable choice for the last day of our holiday and we would certainly go back there if in Miami as we really enjoyed it - nothing to fault

Reviews.Title: “Dated room, but okay”
Reviews.Author: MartyMcSuperFly
Reviews.Content: I was booked here by AA when my connection was missed, so I was pleased that the front desk was able to offer a choice of rooms, and also that the bar was open late and accepted the food vouchers from the airline. Check-in and check-out were very easy. The food at the bar was okay. The room felt very dated. It was dark, both the decor and the lighting. The room had doors to connect to adjacent rooms on both sides. The bed had nice linens and was comfortable. Overall, it was fine for an overnight stay, and the airport shuttle ran regularly.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been better off sleeping on a bench at the airport”
Reviews.Author: cbp079
Reviews.Content: I had a truly horrible experience with the Crowne Plaza Miami Airport. Traveling by myself and dealing with a late arriving flight and early morning connection-I chose the Crowne Plaza because it 'was' a trusted name, very close to the airport and had a shuttle. What would have been 6 hours of sleep ended up being 3 hours after the LONG wait for the shuttle, check in, & lack of staff. 1) Waited at the airport for 50minutes for a shuttle (phoned the front desk twice-waited on hold for 7 minutes the first time, 8 1/2 minutes the second time) 2) Shuttle arrives and the driver does not even get out of the shuttle. I walked on to the shuttle with all my bags and the other guests let me know that the driver won't help and that we have to load the bags in the back. I step off the shuttle, load my bags-never see the driver. 3) Waited 20minutes to check in at 1am 4) Asked for a luggage trolley to take my bags to my room and the lone staff member on duty at the front says there are none 'not sure where they are' 5) I took all of my bags to the room myself (no offer of help) 6) shuttle didn't run regular (supposed to be every 20 minutes) in the morning, so there were too many of us at 5am that I got stranded...again OVERALL, NOT A RELIABLE HOTEL! All of the customers checking-in with me complained about the experience we all endured and there was NO attempt to assist in the situation. We eve asked for a note to be left with the manager-nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Its just alright, for the money its just plain ok”
Reviews.Author: rc29b1
Reviews.Content: For 180 + a night I would of expected more, location is horrible unless your an airline pilot going in and out of the airport. I stayed for 5 days, my key cards stopped working every day or two, which means you can't get in or out of the parking lot or use the elevators. Speaking of elevators, slowest ever... When they worked, usually one was broken. The rooms were no better than my local 60 dollar a night motel 6. I never had to use their well stouted shuttle service but there was at all times 10 plus people waiting irritated for a shuttle to take them to the airport while there were 4 parked outside with drivers just standing around talking. Also if u plan on driving or renting a car it costs an additional 13 bucks a night to park. Food was pretty low par and expensive, service was awful at the restaurant and bar and unless u like spanish food it was your only option. Old school tv's as well, internet was ridiculously slow and couldn't even get 4g on my cell phone if I was within 3 meters of the hotel, like I said ok experience, but not for the price and especially not for a crowne plaza... Come on guys, probably will avoid in the future unless its for a layover cause of how close it is to the airport

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money-dirty room, rude workers”
Reviews.Author: srwheelie
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before our cruise-myself, husband and 2 kids. We waited over 30 minutes to be picked up at the airport and then when the van got there-the driver opened the door and said it was full and he would come back in 20 minutes-my husband looked in the van window and there were 4 seats available, so we got on anyway and loaded our own luggage. When we arrived at the hotel there was a huge line to check in-we stood in line over 30 minutes. I asked what time the shuttle would take us to the pier and the person laughed at me and said there is no shutte. When I made the reservations I specifically asked that and was transferred to speak to someone directly who informed me there was a shuttle to the pier for $1 per person which is the main reason I booked this. We got to our room at 1 AM and the floor was FILTHY-we couldn't take our socks off it was so disgusting. Went to breakfast the next day and for $38 we got next to nothing-bad food, worse service-totally disappointed. And then had to get a cab to take us to the pier-$25 I wasn't planning on spending....My check out bill was $238 and that is a joke-This is one of the worst hotel experiences I can ever remember-Do not waste your money here!

Reviews.Title: “This place sucks!”
Reviews.Author: Travlerman029
Reviews.Content: First time here. Bad experience. Very slow Internet, crappy room service which tacks on $20 surcharge per order, no one speaks English, freezing cold pool, moldy and smelly hot tub, crap sauna with a door that doesn't close and airplanes constantly flying over your room. We paid $250 per night and didn't even have valet or a bell man to help us. Don't stay here. Try Hampton down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight stay after long flight”
Reviews.Author: BreakfastkingHull
Reviews.Content: Stopped here for one night after flying in from the UK. Hotel is close to the airport and offers a free shuttle (every 20 minutes). Check in was quick and efficient. Room was of a good size and clean. Breakfast is available and the continental choice at $11 is good value. We had to pick up a hire car from the airport and the shuttle took us direct to the car hire center - a nice touch. Overall a good stay and we would recommend this hotel if you are using Miami airport.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, rennovated room”
Reviews.Author: dmgmd
Reviews.Content: Be sure to tell them that you want a rennovated room and you should be extremely pleased. Our immaculate room was lovely with extremely comfortable bedding and a lovely bathroom. Though we were close to a busy airport, our room was very quiet and we had a great night's sleep. We parked our car and left it in their lot while we were away for a few days. The shuttle from the airport to the hotel was very convenient. If we need a place to stay near the airport, we would definitely stay here again and we would recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but a little pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Firsttown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a conference that was being held at this same hotel. Shuttle service from the airport was great, check in was a little slow as many people were checking in at the same time. The room was in good shape; clean, safe and quiet! The hotel staff were always doing something cleaning, giving directions, helping people with there bags, etc. One of the doorman (Jesus) was a wealth of knowledge of the Miami area, and seemed to have an answer or solution to just about anything! The conference rooms were clean and orderly with plenty of ice water and mints on every table. All of the AV equipment worked well. Improvements: the internet speed was very slow. At the breakfast bar -- be sure you know what is covered under "free" and what you have to pay for. The quality of food was good but the service was a little slow, which meant they served some of the food cold. For a conference or an overnight stay to go on a cruise, we would stay here but not necessarily if we were on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: tomden
Reviews.Content: It didn't start too good, we were told to wait for the shuttle at the airport on the departures level. We waited for about 30 minutes at the shelter and never even saw a Crowne Plaza shuttle. Took a cab that cost $10.00 and upon arriving at the hotel to our surprise 3 shuttles are parked at the door. I told the front desk but was not offered anything besides a "sorry about that". The hotel itself is very nice and the rooms are very clean and comfortable, after all it is what really counts, a good clean bed to sleep and a clean bathroom to take a shower. Then comes New Year 2011! Wanting to get ourselves a bit more champagne I went to the bar to purchase a bottle only to be told that the bar was closed, strangely the bartender continued serving clients until 1:00am. Breakfast! Not the best but still acceptable. Conclusion a good place for a layover, to my opinion a bit far from the cruise port.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly hotel, but .....”
Reviews.Author: globalswede
Reviews.Content: Crowne plaza at the airport is perfect for early flights, shuttles leave every 20 minutes, but be in place 5 minutes before as the one I was to take left 2 minutes before schedule.. Staff at the hotel are friendly, always asking how one is, service is quick, food decent at restaurant. As long as everything works and no problems occur, service flows, but when something malfunctions the service lacks. On return to room after 7 hours out on town, the room was not cleaned. Called the front desk, they would call back, 40 minutes later - nothing. Called again, the explanation was that I would have left the "don't disturb" sign on door... Which I had not as I wasn't even in the room. Silly excuse from front desk. A tip to the hotel: instead of making up excuses, just send a housekeeper for the cleaning and problem is solved.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Business Hotel or Miami Layover”
Reviews.Author: APKSantaCruz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel five times this year en route to Haiti. The beds & bedding are very comfortable and I found the rooms, bathrooms and bedding clean. The shuttle runs on time every 20 minutes. The hotel and bar staff are very nice and helpful. If you need to catch an international flight or cruise this is the perfect place to stay for a good night sleep and exceptional value. My only wish is that they served better coffee in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “The 1980's called and want their hotel back”
Reviews.Author: TokyoEdo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel due to some business I had in Miami. Arrived on a Sunday to find some type of clandestine farmers market adjacent to the property. When I stepped into the hotel, I expected to see Crockett and Tubbs (Miami Vice) come walking through. This place could really use some modernization. Front desk friendly enough. Room was kind of dirty. I stayed for almost a week and noticed that they didnt do a very good job at cleaning the room. The couch in my room and the desk chair looked like something from a Motel 6 along the interstate. One of three elevators was broke for my entire visit. No ice on the third floor for the whole week (sign said "temporarily out of order") but it probably still is. 13.00 a day parking? Come on. The hotel is in the barrio, so I expect there to be some security provided by the hotel without dumping the cost on travelers. Never could get the wireless internet to work with my computer for more than 30 seconds. Called the "help" line the hotel provided. Someone in India said they could fix the problem but never was able to. Good thing I had my smartphone. Lots of flight crews stay at this hotel. They seem to get the preferential treatment. I stay at better hotels, but this one was a discounted rate for my business. Wouldnt stay here again or recommend it to my colleagues.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a stopover before flight!”
Reviews.Author: lovadasun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night after our cruise and couldn't have been happier. We got there very early, as in 9am, and they had a room for us. Amazing. The shuttle to the airport runs every 20 mins and there is a great seafood restaurant, Catch of the Day, just down the street! Pool area was nice, even with the planes flying right overhead...completely expected this staying so close to the airport though. The rooms are very well insulated. We took a nap first thing when we got in and you can't hear a thing from outside. Not ideally located for really any other reason, but overall, the perfect spot for a night before a flight!

Reviews.Title: “great for a stopover between flights”
Reviews.Author: petebron
Reviews.Content: Very clean and great service, good value for money for a stopover between flights.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for one night only!”
Reviews.Author: Kanguro10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Sunday 29 August as we were arriving really late from Australia and were flying out into Orlando the next morning. We also stayed here as we are member of the priority club and got a good rate for one night accommodation The hotel provides a free shuttle bus which picks you up from the airport. It is only 5â€™ away from the airport Accommodation was fine and room was clean and comfortable. The room style is old. I would stay at this hotel only if I am transiting in Miami for one night; otherwise I would stay in Downtown or South Beach

Reviews.Title: “No. Just no.”
Reviews.Author: leeleebee
Reviews.Content: Staying on a busy road near the airport is never my first choice, but I had to stay here for two nights in August as the location was close to where I was working and the company had a corporate rate. This is a run-down and uninviting property. The lobby is nothing special and the front desk staff is less than welcoming. The elevators are slow and often don't open on the floor that you need, even if you follow the directions and put in your room key. The rooms are drab and didn't give off an appearance of being clean. Don't bother with the breakfast buffet -- it's not worth the money. However, there aren't any restaurants nearby either . . . I would absolutely NOT return.

Reviews.Title: “JUST A BUSTED JOINT ALL THE WAY AROUND....”
Reviews.Author: Ethan49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Crowne returning from Key West to California after staying at the Hilton at Miami airport on the way out. What a terrible decision. This place is, quite simply, a dump. We travel quite a bit and don't expect much from airport hotels, however, when we checked into our first room, not only was the night manager "aloof", our first room smelled, and I mean Nevada Motel 6 bad. So we requested a room change, at which point we were told to return to the front desk (which takes a while in the beat-down elevators) with our belongings and, without apology, given another room which was larger in size (gee, thanks for the offer to have someone help with the bags....). This room was also a dump, with no towels and no amenities! Sweet, right? This place looks as if no one has invested a dime in the past 25 years or so, stained carpets, stained wallpaper, etc... just a busted joint all the way around. Avoid the Crowne in Miami, look at the newer hotels on the lagoon right across the highway which include the Hilton and at least 3 others.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a one-night stay”
Reviews.Author: 1bar2far
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a functional hotel from the 70's or 80's which would have been top-notch then. Now it is underwhelming and needs some updating. The lobby is certainly not up to the higher quality levels typical of Crowne Plaza. I was in and out for one night and was very glad of the airport shuttle which met my needs perfectly. Don't expect to walk out into the heart of art deco South Beach.... Check-in was friendly enough, bed comfortable and a/c worked well.

Reviews.Title: “Used to be really nice, but got old and under-invested”
Reviews.Author: DannyKanada
Reviews.Content: I used to stay at this hotel for the past 8 years. Location, for quick air travellers, is a must. From there you can go almost anywhere as it is strategically located in Miami. The Crowne Plaza brand should mean excellent good price-quality reward. This hotel was like that until a few years ago, however it is spiralling down quickly. My room was at the Quiet Zone (I'm Platinum Priority member), however the carpet was very old, there was a whole in the corridor roof (A/C maintenance?) and at the room... The A/C system is old, very old. You set a temperature and then it makes noisy kick starts each 15 minutes... how can you sleep like that? The toiled flush was not working. The front desk was informed the morning of the day before I left, and they did absolutely nothing. On the eve of my departure (I was taking a very early flight), I asked for a wake-up call. I would be sleeping until today shouldn't my wife had put her alarm clock on. I complained at the front desk and they spared me from paying one night, however what I really wanted was my good Crowne Plaza back to shape. It is unpleasant for me, however I will have, in my next trip to Miami, to try other 4 or 5* hotels near the Airpt. I won't be able to stay at this hotel again unless I am proven that it has been refurbished and that personel went a full scale training.

Reviews.Title: “Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: Mommystyle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when returning from a trip to the caribbean. It is close to the airport, the rooms were fine, free internet, and the airport transportation was nice to have. The Latin Cafe across the street was very good, as was the "Catch of the Day" for breakfast/lunch/dinner. Jorge in the cocktail lounge was very nice, and he makes a great martini or mojito. For the money, I say this was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Suprised me”
Reviews.Author: MspTripper
Reviews.Content: I wasn't expecting much. The price, even with getting points, was quite reasonable. It was close to the airport and had a shuttle. There were flight crews staying there. But in spite of all these things that lead me to expecting a just ok experience I liked this place and was very pleasantly surprised.

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: Critipraise
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Crowne Plaza hotels all over the world - this isn't one. Reasonable value and perfectly acceptable standards but...don't expect anything other than a comfortable and reasonably-priced hotel for accommodation either whilst you recover from, or wait for, a flight.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, OK Location”
Reviews.Author: LolaEverett31
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel-updated and clean. Parking was a huge issue and they almost towed my rental because the front desk had run out of parking passes the night I checked in. Traffic and highways are a bit troubling. This hotel is not anywhere near the beath either, so don't stay here to get some rays. Of course, Miami is gorgeous, but make sure to learn some basic Spanish before your jaunt.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Downtown48
Reviews.Content: I booked this through Hotwire.com which always seems to spit out Crown Plaza's so they must have some kind of deal worked out. I've never had a problem at the CP and this one was no exception. The place felt upscale and was convenient to get to the airport early the next morning. It was a little annoying to have to pay $13/day for a parking spot in their fenced in lot; but I guess you can expect that in any big city. They made up for it with free wi-fi in the rooms. We didn't hear any airplane noise despite its close proximity to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: steve1708
Reviews.Content: Given this is not the cheapest hotel chain and my rate was quite high, it was ok but nothing special,and indeed I found a couple of things dissapointing, I am a goldcard holder with the IHG chain and had just left a previous hotel where I was treated like one, it didnt happen here, check in was slow, (not ultra slow but when one has been up for 24 hours one wants a quick easy check in) I was very thirsty but the bar was unattended(it was past 2300 to be fair but the reception staff told me it was open). I stayed 5 days and used the restuarant for breakfast every day and can report they achieved poor service every day, I had to ask for coffee on several occassions and twice had to remind them, I was even served poached eggs on toast without the eggs! I was paying a fairly high rate for the room yet they stll charged me 13 bucks a night to park my hire car. If the service here was the same at all IHG hotels, I wouldnt be using them again. I will not use this particular CP again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and free shuttle to the airport”
Reviews.Author: everythingwastaken
Reviews.Content: I travelled with my husband, and 2 kids - age 13 & 15 and we stayed here on 2 different nights, March 13th and March 21st. We flew into Miami a day early before our cruise and stayed here. The bellmen are so accomodating and friendly. We did have a transfer service arranged for us $40 total, one way, from this hotel to the Miami pier. On our first night we didn't arrive until quite late so we didn't use any of the facilities except to go down to the bar and have some appetizers that were quite good. There is a restaurant here but we didn't go and have a meal there. On our return from the cruise we grabbed a cab from the pier to this hotel for $23 total, so a much cheaper way to travel. Because we arrived in the morning, the hotel staff said they would store our luggage for us as there wasn't a room yet available so we sat by the pool (water isn't heated and very cold) and caught some more sun. On Sundays there is a market right next door and we walked there and bought some fruit to have for a snack. A room was available about an hour later and there was plenty of room for the 4 of us. The bathrooms here have lots of counter space compared to other Crowne Plazas that we have stayed at. Don't forget to take a room key with you anywhere you go in the hotel as if you need to go on to the elevator you do need a key to be able to push a floor number on which you want, with no key the elevator won't travel upwards. My teens did go to the business office to use the computers, they are free but incrediably slow. A shuttle bus was available to get us from hotel back to the airport for our flight home with no problems at all. Have no worries about staying here unless you are looking for a pool to swim in as it was quite cold. Enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “All around pretty nice”
Reviews.Author: TracyMontreal
Reviews.Content: Clean, nice rooms and lots of hot water morning & night. Pool area was very nice and sauna and jacuzzi were fun (jacuzzi extremely hot). The noise wasn't bad at all considering you're right near the airport. Convenient bus shuttle to the Dolphin Mall ($10 adult, $5 children roundtrip) definitely cheaper than a taxi!! Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A nice & convenient hotel by the airport”
Reviews.Author: AdamHull
Reviews.Content: We spent the night there on route to Honduras 2 weeks ago.It was very near to Miami international airport,we caught a 'blue' cab outside airport(it cost $10-standard) and it took less than 10 minutes to its door.It was booked through expedia & it included breakfast(reception has to see proof of breakfast inclusion!).It was on a main road & we ate evening meal across the road,there were choices of restaurants.Hotel was beautiful and spacious,staff were friendly & helpful.Mind you they spoke better Spanish than English.Room was very nice and internet connection was free(it took me a while to get connected).Bathroom with plenty of hot water.A few reviews mentioned noises from air traffic,but I had to admit that this was NOT a problem to us at all.Yes, hotel was in the flightpath,but last planed landed before midnight.The next morning hotel courtesy bus took us back to airport,free of charge.It ran every hour.Overall we have no complaint at all about this hotel, we will definately go back if we land in Miami again.

Reviews.Title: “Book this if you want to be kept awake all night”
Reviews.Author: apesey
Reviews.Content: This is probably the noisiest hotel I have ever stayed in . I should have been alerted to the ear plugs the hotel leave on the bed. It truly feels that you are sleeping on the runway not only that but when the planes stop the walls are so thin you can hear everything (yes everything) that takes place in the other rooms. Thank goodness we only stayed the night as it made us appreciate every other hotel we have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “The airport would have been more confortable”
Reviews.Author: JPhil915
Reviews.Content: Our flight has been cancelled. The airplane company sent us at this hotel. First of all, the room smelt like cat litter, the shower was broke and the blanket was dirty. They gave us an other room which was ok but not that great and definitely not more than 2 stars. So if you miss your flight and the company offer you this hotel you should stay at the airport all night long, a chair could be more confortable.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, average”
Reviews.Author: xTravellerx
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel for my one night stay because of the location near the airport and hotel shuttle. The hotel is indeed near the airport, and the planes fly low directly over the hotel - so the room was terribly noisy. Otherwise the room was very comfortable and clean. There was a coffee and tea making possibility, but the tea was missing. Breakfast buffet was included in my room price, so I'm not sure how much I ended up paying for that lousy breakfast. The hotel had a pool, but I unfortunately did not have time to test it. Don't stay here, if you are not ready to tolerate the continously roaring planes.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT! ONE DISASTER AFTER ANOTHER! BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: CarefreeRetiree2002
Reviews.Content: We selected the Crowne Plaza as we wanted a fairly upscale hotel for our Finnish friends who were arriving from Helsinki. When I checked in, I notified the staff when our friends would be arriving at the airport. They arrived at the hotel at 10:30 p.m., only to be told that their room was not ready. I know the reason; I saw the "do not disturb" sign on their room door. There was a steady stream of airline personnel, and their room, which we had booked and prepaid more than one month ago, had been rented out. I heard the person in their room leaving at about 8:00 p.m. or 9:00 p.m. So the hotel had actually rented out the room twice during an overlapping time period. Our friends had been up for 24 hours in transit, and were forced to sit in the bar for an hour waiting for their room to be readied. The Crowne Plaza bar had only three bottles of any imported beer left, and these were served without a glass; we drank from the bottle. Then the bar attendant called our friends' room at 12:30 a.m., when they were finally asleep, to ask them come down to the desk and leave a credit card for the bar bill. The reason that they had not done so was that the personnle at the desk were busy dealing with quite a few other late arrivals, all of whom were irate at having been informed that their rooms were not ready either. In the morning as we were leaving, we heard other guests complaining that the hot water had run out (I have seen this mentioned in two reviews for this hotel across two web sites. so it evidently was not an isolated problem). To add insult to injury, when we looked at the charge on our credit card, we had been OVERCHARGED for the room. We have called twice since then to discuss the hotel charges, as we have written receipts with the guaranteed rates prnted with our confirmation; this is why we prepaid in the first place); the first time the billing person was not there, and the second time the person tried to blow us off, saying that these were parking and bar charges (those were placed on separate credit cards, for which we have receipts as well); it was stated that she would have to consult with another person and would call us back; we have not received a call back yet, so the matter is still unresolved, and the billing person basically was argumentative rather than fixing the situation for which we have written documentation.Finally, before leaving the hotel, I asked to speak to the manager about my concerns, and was told that he was in a meeting indefinitely. NEVER AGAIN for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: QueenTaz
Reviews.Content: The room was decent enough but had no microwave. No big deal because we were only there for one night. My two biggest problems with this hotel were the cost of parking and the rude receptionists at check-out. Okay, after driving almost 11 hours to Miami, we got to the hotel around 10pm. We had to pay $13.00 to park literally in the back of the hotel where there is barely any lighting and no entrance door. We had to walk all the way around the building with all of our luggage. Once we were completely inside the hotel, a bellhop had the nerve to ask if we needed help getting our things to the room. We get to the room and I was unimpressed. It was clean but it was just average. I've stayed in Super 8 Motels nicer than that. We ordered room service since we didn't stop for dinner and were told it would be about 20-25 minutes for our personal pepperoni pizzas. Well after 35 minutes, we called downstairs and were told it would be another 10-15 minutes. By this time, it was almost midnight. Once the pizzas got there they had mushrooms and sausage on them! I'm not sure how you get mushrooms and sausage from 2 pepperoni pizzas! Needless to say we sent them back and went to bed hungry. We woke up, showered and decided not to eat in the hotel restaurant because breakfast was ridiculously priced just like parking. They wanted $11.00 for a cold buffet, which included fruit, pastries and yogurt. It was an additional $13.00 or more for hot food such as omelets, bacon, etc. That didn't include your drink! Are you kidding me?! After paying $110.00 for the room, you want me to pay about $25.00 per person for mediocre breakfast? We went to the Burger King down the road from the ship dock. But before we left the hotel, I had the displeasure of talking to the check-out receptionists. They were both rude and unprofessional to say the least. I listened to how they talked to the other customers on the phone and the people ahead of me in line. It was unacceptable. I'm not sure how long I waited to be helped before stepping up to the counter and asking when can I be checked out (they kept looking at me but not helping me), but when I did, the young man said "oh, I guess I can do that." Idiot! He was short with me and not helpful at all. My anger with my stay got me so preoccupied that I left my toiletry bag sitting right on the counter and walked out of the hotel without realizing it. Their service was so bad that they didn't even call me back to let me know that I'd left it. I didn't realize it until I was aboard my cruise ship heading towards Cozumel. I was livid. When I called the hotel, the receptionist said in a nonchalant voice, "oh yeah, it's here." Nice! When I returned to the hotel to get my toiletry bag after my cruise, my bottle of lotion was missing. How do you like that?! That hotel makes me never want to stay in any Crowne Plaza ever again! And wouldn't you know they didn't send me an email survey to rate my stay! Go figure!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mariehd1985
Reviews.Content: My flight was early so when I arrive to the hotel it was 10:00am and the check-in normally is not before 3 or 4pm but the manager find us a room for my 7 days stay. We had a good service, the rooms are nice with comfy bed. We were located at the 5th floors in the quiet zone, that was really a big plus! There's not a lot of restaurant choice around the hotel. We didn't rent a car, so we had to take the bus to the beach (one hour ride) so I must say next time we will rent a car!! Great hotel overall!! a+++

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but unsavory experience with front staff”
Reviews.Author: DelBueno
Reviews.Content: Iberia Airlines kept us in Miami for one day. AVOID IBERIA AIRLINES!! Anyways, they placed us in this hotel and I have to say that the hotel was nice, really nice. The location? Not that nice, a rather lousy area of town. But the problems came with the front desk staff who failed to inform us about the fact that their access cards for the room stop working at noon or so. We went up to the room to take our bags after we had breakfast and the card worked in the elevator but when it didn't work in the room I went down and asked about this and this is when a rather pedantic front desk person started lecturing me about patience when all I wanted is to take the shuttle back to the airport in the hope that Iberia (LOUSY AIRLINE) did manage to get us to Spain. I told the lady to spare me the lecture and give me the key to which she responded by threatening to call security on me? Absolute madness. This was the only soiled spot on a wonderful experience with the hotel. I hope their management reads this and trains the staff to avoid treating customers like school children.

Reviews.Title: “night stop only!”
Reviews.Author: valethatch
Reviews.Content: Very close to airport so ideal for resting up after nine hour flight. Room well appointed and clean, staff pleasant but too little to do with few guests at weekend. Not knowing area reluctant to find somewhere close by so chose the coffee shop. Evening meal very indifferent but breakfast much better.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE! MUST TRY IT!”
Reviews.Author: pinstriped_cats
Reviews.Content: This was the nicest hotel and the staff was just as friendly as they could be! As soon as we pulled up in the cab and were getting out, one of the staff members came up with a great big smile, "WELCOME! May I help you with your luggage?" Well knock me over! The smile was plenty, but then the offer to assist us? As we walked in, the place was just as spotless as it could be. Staff well dressed, professional, very friendly, informative and helpful :) Check in took less than minutes and with smiles we were on our way to our room. The room was wonderful! perfect temperature, SUPER CLEAN.bathroom and room!!! A nice little "welcome" kit on the pillow with eye mask, lavender bed linen spray and a couple other little extras! The view wasnt great..we were on the 6th floor and you could see downtown (im assuming it was downtown) and you have a view of the pool and the restaurants from the room we were in (628), but we werent there for the view. ;) We checked out the menu and headed to their restaurant Cafe 950. AMAZINGLY awesome food! EVERYTHING was cooked to perfection, hot and fresh! Coming from me, thats a big deal! The service was outstanding and the manager came over after a little while to see if we needed anything and if the food was up to par. WOW! what a place! we've already booked another stay for next week!

Reviews.Title: “Great airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: guibox
Reviews.Content: We stayed here one night after flying in before we checked into our condo for the week. It is a clean, well secured hotel. They take their security seriously enough that you even need your key to operate the elevator! The fitness room was decent and the outdoor pool area was really good! We enjoyed spending our morning suntanning by the pool! Every so often, you will hear the occasional plane fly overhead but not enough that any reasonable individual should have a problem with it. There also seemed to be a small flea market right next door to the hotel too, though we never got the chance to go check it out. The staff is helpful and friendly and offered to call us a cab to take us to where we needed to go. There seems to be enough along the strip for eating and other places of interest to check out. I would stay here again if given the chance!

Reviews.Title: “Good Airport Hotel”
Reviews.Author: strandgal
